headline: Best Monkey Bread
description: This monkey bread is the best thanks to this easy recipe that uses canned biscuits and is baked in a tube pan with walnuts for added crunch.

video.description: This sweet, sticky, gooey pull-apart bread, whimsically called "monkey bread," is a popular oven-baked treat for breakfasts, desserts, and snacks. This video will show you how to make our top-rated recipe with how-to tips to guarantee success.
video.name: How to Make Monkey Bread

name: Best Monkey Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease one 9- or 10-inch tube or Bundt® pan.
Mix white sugar and cinnamon in a plastic bag. Cut biscuits into quarters. Shake 6 to 8 biscuit pieces in the sugar-cinnamon mix.
Arrange pieces in the bottom of the prepared pan. Continue until all biscuits are coated and placed in the pan. If using walnuts and raisins, arrange in and among the biscuit pieces as you go along.
Melt margarine with the brown sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat. Boil for 1 minute. Pour over the biscuits.
Bake in the preheated oven for 35 minutes. Let bread cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a plate. Do not cut! The bread just pulls apart.

review.reviewBody: Needs 6 stars! I used Stephanie's suggestion of frozen yeast roll dough, and preparing overnight, and then baking it in the morning. Served it at brunch to a group of 10 -- who raved and asked for the recipe. YUM.

I got brave. I don't like biscuits, so I purchased two loaves of frozen white bread dough and let them sit covered in the refrigerator over night to thaw and to rise a bit. Then I cut across the loaves making 1 inch cuts. I then cut each of those "slices" into 6 pieces making about 3/4" pieces of dough. I rolled those pieces in the cinnamon/sugar and put them in the bundt pan with walnut pieces and raisins and allowed them to sit for 30 minutes to rise just a bit more. From there I followed the remainder of the directions as stated. It was done a bit before the full time but was amazing! Didn't last long at all!
To much sugar for me

Instead of biscuits I use cinnamon rolls (Pillsbury), cut into quarters and layered with pecans, raisins and some of the icing in a bunt pan. When finished baking I put the remaining icing on top. Its GREAT!
No changes--I've been making this recipe for years! Neighbours love it.
Pretty good and easy to make. I would highly recommend increasing the sauces by 1/3 however as you barely have enough to cover the bread.
I used 2cans of Grand biscuits. Cut them into 6 pieces. It's good

We have been making this every Saturday morning for several weeks. The kids love it! They like helping cut the biscuits with a pizza cutter. We double the butter (margarine) and brown sugar to make sure everything is well coated and we leave out the walnuts and raisins. Our biscuit packages were 16oz instead of 12oz so we used 2 cans instead of 3.

Changes I made was using real butter as opposed to margarine and I also used about double the cinnamon. I also did not add any of the optional ingredients. The next time I make this I'll probably use less of the sugar asked for, I had about half of the mixture left.
Easy and DELICIOUS!!!!!
Tasty and fun to eat

Great recipe, I omit the nuts n raisins and use my own dough (Red star yeast Company no knead recipe) I have used a tube pan and bunt too. Just place a cookie sheet under both to avoid spillage and bad smells. Add Dolce de Leche on top before serving
This is easy and yummy. Yes, you can use a bundt pan or a one piece tube pan. I have both. Not all tube pans are two pieces. Make safe decisions for your family and everything will be fine.
Easy recipe. I added apples and pecans. It was delicious!

5 STARS!!!
The monkey bread is so good and crunchy .
It is so yummy, delicious and good!
Soft, crunchy and full of cinnamon flavor and the ingredients are easy enough to make it all the time. This recipe reminds me of my aunt. Definitely will make again!
-Linda from Mrs. Dicskson's class

It didn't seem to have enough caramel sauce. I wonder if I would like it more if I were to put the caramel at the bottom of the pan so that when I turn it over it would ooze down the sides better. Also, my personal preference is for more nuts and no raisins.
Family favourite! I usually use 2 packages of biscuits and cut down on the other ingredients.
It wasn't as gooey as what I'm used to.

Our holiday tradition! can't beat it!! easy to make, grandkids participate coating biscuit pieces and sprinkling nuts....while I do the sauce over top... they love watching it cook in the oven. USE A BUNDT PAN!

Delicious!! Just the way it is... for those using the WRONG kind of tube pan.. word to the wise. Always read the entire recipe including editors notes where it clearly states “use only a solid tube pan”

I made monkey bread muffins. I followed the same recipe except I used parchment paper and my jumbo muffin pan. This allowed me to use various ingredients that some of the kids like (raisin and cranberries) and the nuts (pecan and walnuts) that my hubby and I love. I used one can of Walmart biscuits since it was an experiment. Everyone loved them! I cut the parchment paper in a t shape to allow the biscuits to rise and puff up as not to have any spillage in the bottom of the muffin cup. I spooned the brown sugar & mixture on each muffin. The aroma was delightful and filled the house! I'm making more in the morning.
Perfect! I didn’t change a thing. Perfect for making w/ my 8 yr old grandson on Saturday morning.
Very good! My family loved it.

Absolutely loved this and it was so easy! Took some of the suggestions with the coating and it came out great! Was so happy to be able to use my William and Sonoma Monkey bread pan finally! This was a perfect addition to our Christmas morning brunch. I made it ahead of time and warmed it up that morning and it was great!
I haven’t made this for many years and it was a request from my adult children over the holiday! They loved it!
Love it! Just like I remembered from my childhood. I used butter instead of margarine
Works better with butter. Use Kerrygold butter. Trust me.

Followed recipe to the T. I put this together the night before without cooking it, and covered with plastic wrap in fridge. Popped it in the oven the next morning for Christmas. It took a bit longer to cook because of everything being cold, but only around 10 minutes longer in my electric oven. This is a great recipe loved by all.

It is very good although I did make a couple of adjustments. Instead of biscuits I use Rhodes frozen dinner rolls, just a personal preference. Instead of cinnamon I use pumpkin pie spice. This is a simple recipe and tastes amazing. I have been making monkey bread for CHRISTmas morning since my daughter was little and for my grandchildren who are 21 & 18.

Simple and easy. Used a bundt pain, quite successfully. Stuck with the basic recipe with wonderful results. Will now make variations. Prefer to go with basic recipe first (unless I absolutely can’t help myself :) I do this in order to see what, if anything is actually needed or what I can then do to customize a recipe to meet my family’s particular (or peculiar:) tastes. This recipe was great as is.
My family loves this recipe! It's a quick and easy dessert. I use kitchen scissors to cut my biscuits right into the bag with the cinnamon and sugar. Saves a ton of time.
Turned out perfect!

I had one can of limited edition Pumpkin Spice Grands and I didn’t want to triple it, I had a 5 cup tall bundt. (This adjusted smaller recipe can be used with cinnamon rolls too) I cut the rolls up into smaller pieces -6 per roll- and I added extra spice to the white sugar shake (cinnamon with dashes of cardomon and mace). In a small bowl I mixed up broken pecans, jumbo raisins, and chocolate covered caramel morsels -about 1 cup total. I used just enough dough pieces to make a layer, sprinkled some of nut mix, another layer of dough then nut mix, leaving 2 full rolls of cut sugared dough pieces to make the last layer since it had to cover more surface. Sprinkled the last of the nut mix on top. I only used 1/4 stick butter and 1/3 brown sugar to pour over this smaller pan. I baked it at 325 convection, or 350 reg, for 18 min. I recommend when you flip it out - to put your rack over a plate to catch drips. I decided to wait until the top gooey layer had been pulled off and eaten to use the icing that came with the rolls.
One of our favorites and so easy. I always use nuts but am looking forward to try raisins. Used 2 16oz packages of biscuits and that works well too - cut in 6 pieces.

Well...I was dissapointed. I remember the brown sugar/butter mixture being added to the bottom of the bunt pan, THEN the sugared biscuit being added on top of that so when you turn it out the "caramel" runs down. With this, when I turned it out, what is now the top was dry- no sticky, gooey yummy. The butter brown sugar sauce did not melt down through the biscuits during baking. Maybe I cooked it a sec too long- who knows? I think Ill stick to adding the butter brown sugar to the bottom 1st. Kinda like an upside down cake.
Perfect as written. Definitely going into regular rotation.
It’s better if you take the time and dip each piece in butter then a brown sugar cinnamon mix. Takes time though. But over all this recipe is simple and kids love it.
Yummy! The whole family enjoyed. This will be a treat to last most of the week!

This recipe is really good: I used every recommendation made by others who made this: Specifically I used two cans of Grands biscuits, cut the biscuits using a pizza cutter, put pecans in before I added the dough, and added the dough half way, then rest of the dough and glaze at the end. It’s perfect. My heart is happy!!
very easy and delicious, the kids loved it. I did make one change and that was cut the biscuits into 6ths instead of 4ths.

Fantastic. They were right about the tube pan. It will drip everywhere if you're not careful. I put a pan underneath to catch all the sugar that dripped from the bottom and washed it right away before it could set. Overall a terrific, simple recipe.

I usually don’t rate or review things but I had to on this recipe!! It’s was super super good, the only thing I changed from the recipe was instead of waiting until it was cooled off to flip it I flipped it hot. I’ve made this recipe two times now and my family and friends love it.(MAKE IT WITH A BUNT PAN) I made the mistake of not making it won’t a bunt pan the first time and the juice leaked thru but lucky I always place a flat pan underneath so it didn’t cause any damage but most of the juice was wasted and not able to make it on the bread! In all love this recipe and recommend it!!!
The second it came out and was flipped, it was gone! Too delicious

The only thing I did different was take the sugar/cinnamon coated dough and place in a bowl. Pour the sauce over dough and gently toss so that all the dough balls are covered. Spoon mixture into your baking pan and pour any extra sauce over the top and bake as directed.

This was wonderful! For some reason, my biscuits turned out doughy, even after 35 minutes. Probably due the high altitude where I live. I think I will put foil over it & bake an additional 10 minutes next time. 
Thanks for the recipe!
Delicious! My 8 year old son helped me make it. He was so proud when everyone loved his desert!
Everybody loved it. Truly was a hit. Definitely make again

One of our favorites for a special brunch. I made single servings in a large muffin pan so we each get hot carmelly goodness on the outside. Next time I'll put the nuts in first so they are on top when I flip them.

What an AMAZING recipe!! I used 4 tablespoons of butter instead of a full stick and 1/2cup of brown sugar instead of the full cup. I also toasted the walnuts, used Annie’s organic biscuits, and 1/4 cup of raisins. Perfect amount of sweetness w/o being too rich.

What an AMAZING recipe!! I used 4 tablespoons of butter instead of a full stick and 1/2cup of brown sugar instead of the full cup. I also toasted the walnuts, used Annie’s organic biscuits, and 1/4 cup of raisins. Perfect amount of sweetness w/o being too rich.
I did not make any changes and my family loved the monkey bread. I will make it again.

Made it for my kids over Mother’s Day and they loved it! I think they’ll be coming home more often now!
 (I left out the nuts and raisins.)
Love it. Just like the recipe I used 25 years ago.
it came out absolutely delicious thank you
yum yum yum
Big hit! Recipe is perfect, didn't change a thing.
Easy and delicious. Might need to make 2 it went quick.....

Flavorful, but both times I’ve made it, it sticks a lot to the bundt pan. Never comes out pretty on the serving tray. It may be an issue on my end, but I’m following recipe to the tee. It is very tasty though!!
Easy to make and so yummy
Omitted nuts and raisins. Very good!
Very good! My picky eaters enjoyed it! Will make again.
Very easy to make. Turned out delish.
I have made it a few times, kids love to help and eat it too....super easy and simple!
Super easy to make and was so delicious!

I will definitely make this recipe again but I did have to make some changes as the brown sugar and butter mixture didn't work when I boiled it on the stove top. It works much better if you melt the butter in the microwave and then add the brown sugar, mix, then pour over the dough. I also used 1 stick and a half and there still wasn't enough to cover the whole bread. Other than that this recipe was delicious and easy to make.

Love this recipe! Makes me a big hit with the grandkids!
I speed up the process by putting the biscuit pieces in a big bowl and tossing them with the melted butter. Then I add the premixed dry ingredients to the bowl, and toss it by hand, to make sure all the biscuits are separated. I use a 9 x 13 pan, which takes around 20 minutes to bake. When ready to serve, I cover the pan with tin foil, place a cutting board over the top of the pan, hold on tight and quickly invert.

I made it with 2 cans of biscuits. I cut them into 4's. Everything went well until I got to the sauce. I used butter as I don't use margarine. It didn't work together well at all. I baked it 30 mims in a bundt pan and the "caramel" hardened into candy ish type stuff. We picked it off and still had good bread.

Really tasty. I ended up with a lot of cinnamon and white sugar left over so I think it'd be fine in the future to eyeball how much coating I'd need. Quick and very easy recipe, it's hard to not eat the whole thing right now
For those concerned the recipe warns against using a 2 piece tube pan for this recipe. A bundt pan or a single piece tube pan works really well.
It was so good! I didn’t have raisins or walnuts so I I used pecans. Reminded me of my moms cinnamon buns. Yummy!
I did not put the raisins or nuts in it. It was delicious and easy to make!
Use a BUNDT pan !!! And you don't actually have to take the time to cut up the biscuits, you can just pinch them into fourths. 30 minutes is enough time.
This is delicious but I had a hard time getting the middle to cook.
Was very easy to make & the family loved it. We took for a Christmas morning snack, weren't allowed to take the leftovers home :-). Guess will have to make our own. Will be a keeper!
Huge hit!! Easy to make and delicious
Made as is. Delicious! Way better than my Rhodes rolls and pudding mix recipe I’ve been using.
It was very yummy and was eaten up from top to bottom. I would make it again because it was quick and easy.
It was great
First time making it turned out like a cinomon bisket
Love this!! Make it for Christmas every year
This recipe is delish as is or can easily be adapted.
Tasted amazing... Not dry at all! coating makes you want to fall in love with it!

As is: #5. I added a can of apple pie filling and everyone says it's over the top! I am going to use only 2 cans of biscuits next time, so all gets coated better. This is very versatile as to what you want to add.
It was delicious and will make again.

Turned out amazing.Made it before my husband and his friends went into the deerwoods and they all Loved it. Have passed it on to a couple of there wifes who plan to make it.By the way my 4 year old granddaughter who hates every thing keeps asking me to make it again !

This is a new family favorite. We did it as a family, for breakfast this morning. My husband was skeptical at first but the minute he saw it, he dug in. That man looked me dead in my eyes with his fork at his mouth and said, “This stuff is dangerous.” And he was SO serious. I sprinkled a bit of powdered sugar on top for aesthetics and left out walnuts. Most definitely making this again!
I used dried blue Berry’s instead of raisins as well as flaky biscuits
Super yummy! I like my dough super soft on the inside and crunchy on the out so I only baked it for 30 minutes, but it turned out beautifully!

So yummy and always a hit! Only downside is can’t find that size of biscuit cans, and only the outside seems to get the yummy brown sugar and butter glaze, the inside was only a little cinnamon sugary. Still very good just wish I had a side of the brown sugar butter glaze!
This was so good. I could only use two cans of biscuits though. 3 cans made the pan overflow once I started baking.
Used four cans and increased sugar mixes accordingly, baked as 2 loaves as I didn't have a bundt pan on hand!

Made this for a breakfast brunch for last Christmas and it was a huge hit! Be sure it gets all eaten by your guests or you will not be able to keep your hands off of the leftovers! 
Very easy to make (I used just plain butter Grand biscuits, not the honey butter variety). I also used craisins versus raisins as we prefer their taste to raisins.
Absolutely wonderful reminds me of the good ol days .
I made it with day old glazed doughnuts worked out fine.

I made this for a breakfast party at work and prepared the dough pieces the night before. I kept them in a Ziploc bag in the refrigerator and in the morning just placed them in the pan and prepared the caramel sauce. Very good results.
Throughly enjoyed!

Followed directions but used butter instead of margarine and pecans instead of walnuts. It turned out awesome. It was a great 20 minute project for me and my girls for movie night. We did not have a problem with it sticking in the pan but we generously sprayed it. We waited 10 minutes for it to cool and it popped out just fine. One note: I suggest you put the cake pan on a sheet pan in the oven because ours bubbled over and started to burn on the bottom of the oven. We used 12oz refrigerated pillsbury buttermilk biscuits.

Monkey bread is a quick easy recipe and my family enjoys it as a treat sometimes for breakfast. Simple to make and delicious to eat and.....kid friendly tooo!! 
I make it in a bundt pan and sometimes I make it with two cans and leave them whole and dip each side in cinnamon/sugar and stand them on end around bundt pan. They bake up great with caramel on the outside and a spot to spread butter on .....yummy ??
So easy & delicious! I baked for 30 min instead of 35. Other than that I followed the recipe and my entire family devoured it!
